required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Retrospective Record Review of Adults and Children Advised for Allergen Immunotherapy (MK-7243-022)
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of Patient Initiation and Persistence With Advised Allergen Immunotherapy

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine the proportion of participants that initiate allergen immunotherapy (AIT) upon the recommendation of their physician and the proportion of participants that persist with their AIT throughout the recommended course.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Advised to Start AIT Who Elected Subcutaneous Immunotherapy (SCIT) Shots or Sublingual Immunotherapy (SLIT) Drops
primary_outcome.description: The percentage of participants who were advised by their physician to start AIT and elected to initiate AIT was calculated. AIT initiation was broken down by type of AIT initiated (SCIT or SLIT).

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Who Initiated SCIT or SLIT and Completed 5 Years of Treatment
primary_outcome.description: The percentage of participants who initiated SCIT or SLIT and completed 5 years of treatment was calculated. Duration of SCIT or SLIT was based on dates when allergy extract prescriptions were refilled. If extract refills continued past the recommended time for therapy (e.g. 5 years from the start of therapy), the participant was deemed successful in completing the recommended course. If the extract refills stopped prior to the end of the recommended time for therapy, but the last refill occurred within 6 months of the recommended time for therapy, this participant was deemed successful in completing the recommended course.

primary_outcome.measure: Duration of Treatment With SCIT or SLIT
primary_outcome.description: The mean duration in years of SCIT or SLIT treatment for all participants with AR who initiated SCIT or SLIT was calculated. Duration of SCIT or SLIT was based on dates when allergy extract prescriptions were refilled.

primary_outcome.measure: Reason for Discontinuation of SCIT or SLIT More Than 6 Months Before Completion of the Recommended Course
primary_outcome.description: The reason for discontinuation of SCIT or SLIT treatment more than 6 months before completion of the recommended course of therapy was recorded. The percentage of participants whose records were reveiwed and who discontinued SCIT or SLIT due to different reasons was calculated.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With a Co-morbidity of Asthma Who Initiated SCIT or SLIT
secondary_outcome.description: The percentage of participants who had AR and asthma and initiated SCIT or SLIT was calculated.

secondary_outcome.measure: Duration of SCIT or SLIT Treatment for Participants With AR and Asthma or AR Alone
secondary_outcome.description: The mean duration in years of SCIT or SLIT treatment for all participants with AR and asthma and for all participants with AR only was calculated. Duration of SCIT or SLIT treatment was based on dates when allergy extract prescriptions were refilled.

arm_group.description: Patients in a private allergy practice who were diagnosed with AR, with or without asthma, and advised to consider AIT between January 2005 and June 2011 and whose medical records were retrospectively reviewed.

study_pop.textblock: Patients who were managed by physicians in a large allergy practice, recommended for AIT between 2005 and 2011 and identified by their electronic health records.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosis of AR with or without allergic conjunctivitis (AC)
- Documented provider-to-patient or parent discussion of AIT as a treatment option
Exclusion Criteria:
- Participants receiving AIT as an AR treatment without documented provider-to-patient or parent discussion of AIT as a treatment option
- Participants receiving immunotherapy for insect sensitivities only
- AIT started before 2005

participant_flow.recruitment_details: This study involved a retrospective record review of patients in a private allergy and asthma practice who were recommended to receive allergen immunotherapy (AIT) to treat their allergic rhinitis (AR) by their physician between January 2005 and June 2011.

group.title: Participants With AR
group.description: Participants with AR whose records were retrospectively reviewed

group.title: Participants With AR
group.description: Participants with AR whose records were retrospectively reviewed

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants Advised to Start AIT Who Elected Subcutaneous Immunotherapy (SCIT) Shots or Sublingual Immunotherapy (SLIT) Drops
outcome.description: The percentage of participants who were advised by their physician to start AIT and elected to initiate AIT was calculated. AIT initiation was broken down by type of AIT initiated (SCIT or SLIT).
outcome.population: The analysis population consisted of those participants with AR who were advised by their physician to receive AIT to treat their AR.

group.title: Participants With AR
group.description: Participants with AR whose records were retrospectively reviewed

measure.title: Percentage of Participants Advised to Start AIT Who Elected Subcutaneous Immunotherapy (SCIT) Shots or Sublingual Immunotherapy (SLIT) Drops
measure.description: The percentage of participants who were advised by their physician to start AIT and elected to initiate AIT was calculated. AIT initiation was broken down by type of AIT initiated (SCIT or SLIT).
measure.population: The analysis population consisted of those participants with AR who were advised by their physician to receive AIT to treat their AR.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants Who Initiated SCIT or SLIT and Completed 5 Years of Treatment
outcome.description: The percentage of participants who initiated SCIT or SLIT and completed 5 years of treatment was calculated. Duration of SCIT or SLIT was based on dates when allergy extract prescriptions were refilled. If extract refills continued past the recommended time for therapy (e.g. 5 years from the start of therapy), the participant was deemed successful in completing the recommended course. If the extract refills stopped prior to the end of the recommended time for therapy, but the last refill occurred within 6 months of the recommended time for therapy, this participant was deemed successful in completing the recommended course.
outcome.population: The analysis population consisted of those participants with AR who were advised by their physician to receive AIT to treat their AR and who initiated AIT.

group.title: Participants With AR
group.description: Participants with AR whose records were retrospectively reviewed

measure.title: Percentage of Participants Who Initiated SCIT or SLIT and Completed 5 Years of Treatment
measure.description: The percentage of participants who initiated SCIT or SLIT and completed 5 years of treatment was calculated. Duration of SCIT or SLIT was based on dates when allergy extract prescriptions were refilled. If extract refills continued past the recommended time for therapy (e.g. 5 years from the start of therapy), the participant was deemed successful in completing the recommended course. If the extract refills stopped prior to the end of the recommended time for therapy, but the last refill occurred within 6 months of the recommended time for therapy, this participant was deemed successful in completing the recommended course.
measure.population: The analysis population consisted of those participants with AR who were advised by their physician to receive AIT to treat their AR and who initiated AIT.

outcome.title: Duration of Treatment With SCIT or SLIT
outcome.description: The mean duration in years of SCIT or SLIT treatment for all participants with AR who initiated SCIT or SLIT was calculated. Duration of SCIT or SLIT was based on dates when allergy extract prescriptions were refilled.
outcome.population: The analysis population consisted of those participants with AR who were advised by their physician to receive AIT to treat their AR and who initiated AIT.

group.title: Participants With AR
group.description: Participants with AR whose records were retrospectively reviewed

measure.title: Duration of Treatment With SCIT or SLIT
measure.description: The mean duration in years of SCIT or SLIT treatment for all participants with AR who initiated SCIT or SLIT was calculated. Duration of SCIT or SLIT was based on dates when allergy extract prescriptions were refilled.
measure.population: The analysis population consisted of those participants with AR who were advised by their physician to receive AIT to treat their AR and who initiated AIT.

outcome.title: Reason for Discontinuation of SCIT or SLIT More Than 6 Months Before Completion of the Recommended Course
outcome.description: The reason for discontinuation of SCIT or SLIT treatment more than 6 months before completion of the recommended course of therapy was recorded. The percentage of participants whose records were reveiwed and who discontinued SCIT or SLIT due to different reasons was calculated.
outcome.population: The analysis population consisted of those participants with AR who were advised by their physician to receive AIT to treat their AR, who initiated and subsequently discontinued AIT, and had their charts reviewed for the reason for discontinuation.

group.title: Participants With AR Who Discontinued SCIT
group.description: Participants with AR whose records were retrospectively reviewed and discontinued SCIT

group.title: Participants With AR Who Discontinued SLIT
group.description: Participants with AR whose records were retrospectively reviewed and discontinued SLIT

measure.title: Reason for Discontinuation of SCIT or SLIT More Than 6 Months Before Completion of the Recommended Course
measure.description: The reason for discontinuation of SCIT or SLIT treatment more than 6 months before completion of the recommended course of therapy was recorded. The percentage of participants whose records were reveiwed and who discontinued SCIT or SLIT due to different reasons was calculated.
measure.population: The analysis population consisted of those participants with AR who were advised by their physician to receive AIT to treat their AR, who initiated and subsequently discontinued AIT, and had their charts reviewed for the reason for discontinuation.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With a Co-morbidity of Asthma Who Initiated SCIT or SLIT
outcome.description: The percentage of participants who had AR and asthma and initiated SCIT or SLIT was calculated.
outcome.population: The analysis population consisted of those participants with AR and asthma who were advised by their physician to receive AIT to treat their AR and who initiated SCIT or SLIT.

group.title: Participants With AR and Asthma
group.description: Participants with AR and asthma whose records were retrospectively reviewed

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With a Co-morbidity of Asthma Who Initiated SCIT or SLIT
measure.description: The percentage of participants who had AR and asthma and initiated SCIT or SLIT was calculated.
measure.population: The analysis population consisted of those participants with AR and asthma who were advised by their physician to receive AIT to treat their AR and who initiated SCIT or SLIT.

outcome.title: Duration of SCIT or SLIT Treatment for Participants With AR and Asthma or AR Alone
outcome.description: The mean duration in years of SCIT or SLIT treatment for all participants with AR and asthma and for all participants with AR only was calculated. Duration of SCIT or SLIT treatment was based on dates when allergy extract prescriptions were refilled.
outcome.population: The analysis population consisted of those participants with AR and asthma or AR alone who were advised by their physician to receive AIT to treat their AR and who initiated AIT.

group.title: Participants With AR and Asthma
group.description: Participants with AR and asthma who elected AIT and whose records were retrospectively reviewed

group.title: Participants With AR Alone
group.description: Participants with AR alone who elected AIT and whose records were retrospectively reviewed

measure.description: The mean duration in years of SCIT or SLIT treatment for all participants with AR and asthma and for all participants with AR only was calculated. Duration of SCIT or SLIT treatment was based on dates when allergy extract prescriptions were refilled.
measure.population: The analysis population consisted of those participants with AR and asthma or AR alone who were advised by their physician to receive AIT to treat their AR and who initiated AIT.

reported_events.desc: Adverse events leading to discontinuation were reviewed in this retrospective chart review, but clinical and laboratory adverse events were not collected prospectively.

group.title: Participants With AR
group.description: Participants with AR whose records were retrospectively reviewed

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The Sponsor shall be notified and have a right to timely and prior review of public disclosures of the results, including without limitation, disclosures at research seminars, lectures and professional meetings and submission of papers for publication.

point_of_contact.name_or_title: Senior Vice President, Global Clinical Development
